headline: Cream Cheese-Filled Bagel Balls
description: Perfect for breakfast and super easy and quick to make, these cream cheese-filled bagel balls are made with a yogurt-based dough that requires no rising time.
name: Cream Cheese-Filled Bagel Balls
recipeIngredient: 1 cup all-purpose flour, or as needed
0.5 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
0.5 cup cream cheese, or as needed
2 teaspoons everything bagel seasoning, or to taste
1 tablespoon butter, melted, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease a baking pan.
Mix 1 cup flour, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt together. Mix in Greek yogurt and knead until all flour is mixed in; if dough is sticky, add more flour.
Cut dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and press each ball into a flat circle; they should look like mini pizzas.

Scoop cream cheese into the center of each circle. Fold the edges up and pinch closed so you have a round ball of dough with cream cheese inside. Make sure you seal the edges so the cream cheese doesn't spill out during baking. Place seam side down on the prepared baking pan.
Mix egg, half-and-half, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl. Brush egg wash on top of each dough ball and sprinkle with bagel seasoning.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush with melted butter before serving.

review.reviewBody: These are so good! I honestly wasn’t expecting much due to the ease of the recipe. My family loved them. They are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I will be making these again. Ty!

Yum! Made them with a group of students today and they were a hit. Add a little flour if they’re sticky and knead dough slightly with hands to bring together. Delicious when sprinkled with cinnamon/sugar or pumpkin pie spice/sugar!

Very tasty!! I didn’t have the bagel seasoning so just made up a mix of what I had.
Great as is but you could easily use flavored cream cheese or even other cheeses I think.
Today I’m going to try with garlic in the dough and cheddar cheese in the center to seven with ravioli for dinner
Thank you!

This is a really easy and versatile recipe. I didn't have geek yougurt ( I don't like it) so I used french-style yogurt with blueberries on the bottom. I tried it twice and liked both, but the second time, I added a little sugar to bring out the taste of the blueberries more. The balls this recipe makes must be huge because I halved the recipe and still got 10 two inch balls. Tasty though.
Quick and easy to make and delicious! I was very pleasantly surprised.
